job_title: Cudtomer Advisor (Contact Centre) in Covington, KY
pros: Co workers i have met while employed.
cons: No support whatsoever! They tell you that they will assist you but they throw in with zero experience. I lasted a little over a month and was told I was not meeting their expectations and literally let go with no warning whatsoever! Worst job i have ever been in and I took this to help ppl. Literally a loke, if they don't they help their employees succeeds! Not to mention, the number of people who quit a week is ridiculous!

pros: Coworkers, and depending on supervisor, the flexibility

pros: Best co-workers you could ever work with!

pros: Doing a job one loves.
cons: Working for employers who are sneaky and untrustworthy.

pros: Agency committed to serving people without discrimination. Good benefits. Job security
cons: Not competitive wages so high turn over.

review_title: How To Ruin An Agency in Seven Years
pros: Zero, Zilch, None...unless you like low (or no) pay, bad benefits, poor management, inept business plans, low morale, and a completely lifeless yet paranoid work environment.
cons: See above. NorthKey was effective and had a pretty good reputation in the community before the current CEO took over in about 2008. It was a decent place with decent pay and great people. Not any longer. Only the most desperate, unlucky, scared, or masochistic employees remain.

review_title: At one time an excellent company.  Now it has been destroyed by poor administration and mistreatment of employees.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Wright, KY
pros: There are no pros unless you enjoy doing hard work for poor pay, poor benefits and an amazing lack of appreciation.
cons: What was once a very good company has now been thoroughly corrupted.  Employees continue to be unappreciated and undervalued.  Management and administration are often dishonest with employees to further their own gain.  Seniority is seen as a liability and many long-time employees were pressured to retire or be terminated without cause.  Quality of patient care has dramatically fallen due to such poor morale and negative working conditions.

pros: Great co-workers, middle management tries to work with the therapist,  many locations and many programs
cons:
High turnover- and to try and stop it Northkey has put into place that if you need supervision you need to "pay it back". For every year you get in free supervision you need to work there for a year or else you need to pay them.  CEO does NOT listen to anything anyone but him has to say.  You have a high billable minimum but no one gets support for the high no calls that happen. And sometimes if you don't make the minimum your benefits will suffer.
  PTO and sick time are the same. PTO is a lower rate than what you make in billable.  The higher ups only care about numbers and not the therapist.

review_title: The Worst Managed Company of All Time
pros: There are no Pros at this place.
cons:
This agency is beyond a joke and beyond hope. They have consistently cut services, pay, and benefits for the last several years. By comparison, another similar local agency, Talbert House, continues to expand without layoffs. NorthKey is run as a dictatorship and the employees live in fear and have absolutely no say in anything. 

NorthKey is way beyond the times for mental health needs. They have no electronic chart yet. You have to see a therapist in order to get medication from a physician, regardless of whether you need the service or not. NorthKey has been the subject of several unflattering articles in the Cincinnati Enquirer over the last half year. 

If you are a new graduate, STAY AWAY from NorthKey. You will get lower pay, benefits, and tuition reimbursement than any comparable job in the Cincinnati area.

pros: Most co-workers on the front line are nice, free supervision if your standards are low enough, at least it gets better after you leave
cons: Minimal pay despite stated hourly wage (you don't get paid for every hour you actually work, only if you can bill the hour,and no show rates are pretty high), NOT a non profit despite the title (it's all about making more money for the agency), pro top admin. policies (highest paid ceo of a non profit in greater Cincinnati), minimal benefits (holidays + 2 weeks, 3 more days after you hit 3 years), absolutely no support from the top down (they only worry about covering their own butts)

pros: Co-workers were amazing and compassionate!
cons: Where do I begin?  Management was atrocious.  No empathy.   They talk a good line, but upper management has no clue what the worker bees are doing.  Vacation time sucks!  You have to work 13 months to EARN 2 weeks of vacation, but new employees coming in get an automatic 2 weeks up front, in addition to earning their 2 weeks!  So unfair.

review_title: “Transforming lives” is a key part of their motto, you’d think it’s for the better but too often it’s for the worst.
pros:
Coworkers and (I can only speak for the few that I knew throughout my tenure) direct managers were excellent. As long as you get a manager who wants to be involved, you will love working for them. 

Office spaces and supplies were great (unless you wanted to, you didn’t need to supply all of your own stuff)

There isn’t a lot of room for advancement, but if you are fine with getting in and settling down you could work for a very long time there. 

Office environments (typically) were laid back
cons:
Retention: the minute you get used to someone they’re gone. 

Little to no incentives or acknowledgement of hard work(not including annual bonus)

Everyone has the mentality that people in lesser roles (than them) can’t have higher wages, better benefits etc because heaven forbid it come close to what they make or have. This is largely an issue with upper management not acknowledging their staff, then them don’t acknowledge theirs and so on. 

Lack of knowledge across the board what all NorthKey does from the staff. NorthKey has so many different things going on, but few of the staff are aware. Common phrase heard in NK from staff: “Oh! You work at NorthKey too, what do you do?........(response given about a role outside of their dept)... So, what’s that? I didn’t know that was a thing”. Simply put... this is embarrassing. Instead of repetitive essential learning on emergency preparedness or something else that no one reads, how about you teach your employees what all NorthKey does so there are fewer awkward conversations at each breakfast (and heaven forbid your employees fully know who they work for).

Burn out is real, you might catch yourself wishing you went into plumbing instead.

pros:
The community of coworkers that turn into family. 
You can potentially switch areas if you don't like what you're doing and you have a degree.
cons:
1. Bosses who forget supervision or feel as though it's not important 
2. Juggling multiple job descriptions because you collect more jobs over time 
3. PTO is atrocious and when you take time off you feel as though you needed to go to confession for it 
4. Benefits WHY IS IT SO EXPENSIVE WHEN YOU HAVE OVER 400 PEOPLE WORKING FOR YOU ??

I worked for North Key for over 5 years. I have had several bosses over that time. In a matter of 3 months I had 3 bosses at one point, for the same position. Most are overworked, most have to meet a quota that is unattainable. Most are promised much more than what is actually given. I worked another care coordinator PFP position within the agency making 42k and when I switched over I made 29k in less than 6 months. Management has gone away from taking care of clients to trying to salvage any profits they can muster. People need help not to be continually pushed away. 

When working with other agencies there should be a level of respect given to your employees in the trenches, not burying them with a hatchet when there is an issue. TALK TO YOUR EMPLOYEES AND ACTUALLY LISTEN - not just when they threaten to leave or put in their notice

review_title: The Worst Place to Work in Northern Kentucky
job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Covington, KY
pros: There are no pros, unless you like to be underpaid, with bad benefits, in an agency that does not value your service. The most current review before this intimated that all the bad reviews were from past employees for a reason -- yes, the reason is that anyone with a shred of sanity has already left this terrible place.
cons: If clients don't show up, you don't get paid. You have no impact on whether they show up. See the problem? Expect to be sick quite often if you choose to work here, because your stress will be high and support from administration will be low.

review_title: Don't let your heart make you stay if your soul is miserable
pros: Clients, flexible hours, supplies were taken care of (you didn't have to buy your own).
cons: Senior managment has horrible rapport with their employees, pay was awful (you'd think working with humans would at least get you a wage that'd be worthy of taking home), negative mentality, no growth opportunity with pay (and I was promoted twice).

review_title: Administrative Oligarchy and Community Mental Health Do Not Mix
pros: Frankly, there are no good reasons to work at NorthKey as of late 2013.
cons:
Bad Pay
Bad Benefits
Uncaring Executive Team
Poor Service
No Communication
Mass Exodus of Best Employees
No Room for Advancement

pros: Many caring people who quite frankly deserve better.
cons: Very high stress environment with a lot of responsibility but low pay and poor benefits.  Long-time employees have been pressured to quit or retire, those who have stayed were stripped of a good protion of their accrued vacation and sick time.  Morale could not be lower.  Employees are highly under-appreciated and those who have been their for many years are seen as a liability.  Raises are nonexistant and there is NO chance of advancement.

review_title: Do a lot of good work for little pay
pros: Big believer in mental health and glad someone is willing to provide services on a sliding scale fee to help those at need
cons: Most of the jobs you do a lot of work, but don't get the pay for the time and effort involved.

review_title: The people are great to work with the professional climate is stagnate and antiquated
pros: The work is rewarding. The work peers are very family oriented. The company has a good reputation in the community.
cons: No options for professional/personal growth. Great for entry level experience but nothing further.  Freeze on raises 4yrs+.

review_title: Abandon all hope, ye who enter here
pros: Helping a medically needy population
cons: The benefits and pay were terrible. The insurance offered was terrible. Everyone there talks about how they're all one big family but gossiping and backstabbing is rife. A couple toxic employees in my department who simply made it an absolutely miserable place to work but management refused to discipline them despite multiple complaints from me and other people. No room to advance or add to your skill set.  The building I worked in was absolutely filthy and I often saw cockroaches scuttling around.

review_title: This is NOT the company it used to be!
pros: The patient care staff members are genuinely caring and compassionate.A great number of employees remained for many years in spite of lower pay than other similar facilities.  Helping patients is truly rewarding.
cons: Poor pay, no raises for several years.  What benefits we had such as sick time and PTO were slashed.  Staff members are not appreciated. There is no advantage for seniority and in fact many long-time employees have been pressured to retire or terminated without just cause.

pros: My co-workers, we were all in the same miserable boat together
cons:
all the bad reviews you are reading - ALL TRUE! all of it.  
If you are looking for a place for your 1 yr experience and move on. This is the place for you, its a revolving door. 
It is really quite embarrassing when you are in St Elizabeth and someone finds out you work for Northkey - Chances are they worked there and they have nothing nice to say.  
Well, soon they will become Erigo and ruin that name too.

pros: Good, caring coworkers.  Many have been there a long time.
cons: Poor pay, no chance of advancement.  Seniority is a liability and they've gotten rid of many long-time employees.  It has been reported they lost much of their funding due to surplus.  There are also rumors of some unethical practices with Kentucky Retirement.

pros: Great co-workers, our patients are awesome.  I wish I could think of more positive things.  Services add value to the community.
cons: Terrible compensation and PTO.  Mileage reimbursement is a joke.  Kids' inpatient needs to be investigated for retraumatizing kids. Kids with mental illness are punished for being sick.  I would not recommend this company to anyone.  Run don't walk if you get offered a job here.

pros: The people who you get to interact with
cons: In the rural areas there is little to no training youre kinda theown out in the vast world with no help , my direct supervisor was never available to. Help and when i asked my trainer specific questions she never had answers

review_title: Great place to make your career!
